column5: DUBAI  Nov 23 - Kuwaiti telecoms operator Zain  on Wednesday signed a $650 million deal to outsource the network of its Iraq unit to Sweden's Ericsson.

column4: Microsoft signs confidentiality pact with Yahoo

column4: Nokia says Windows Phone excellent start in Britain
column5: Nov 23 Nokia said sales of its first Windows Phone model  the Lumia 800  were off to an excellent start in Britain  dismissing analyst comments of weak sales start  which have hit shares in the Finnish company.

column4: Netflix lawsuit dismissed
column5: LOS ANGELES (TheWrap.com) - A multi-million-dollar class action lawsuit against Netflix and Walmart that alleged the two companies had conspired to carve up the DVD rental and sales market between them has been dismissed.

column4: U.S. judge sides with Netflix in antitrust lawsuit
column5: A U.S. judge granted Netflix's bid to resolve all claims in its favor before trial in an antitrust class action  in which plaintiffs had sought hundreds of millions of dollars in damages.

column4: Netflix shares hurt by bleak 2012 outlook
column5: Netflix Inc's shares dropped as much as 7 percent on Tuesday after it warned of a loss for 2012  a move the prompted several Wall Street analysts to cut their price targets for the online video and DVD rental company.

column4: U.S. judge sides with Netflix in antitrust lawsuit
column5: Nov 22 A U.S. judge granted Netflix's  bid to resolve all claims in its favor before trial in an antitrust class action  where plaintiffs had alleged Netflix reached an agreement with Wal-Mart to divide the market for sales and online rentals of DVDs in the United States.

column5: PARIS  Nov 23 The escalating euro zone crisis  with the threat of economic downturn and of increased contingent liabilities  could put France's AAA sovereign rating at risk  credit rating agency Fitch said on Wednesday.

column4: Costly U.S. health system delivers uneven care: OECD
column5: WASHINGTON The U.S. healthcare system is more effective at delivering high costs than quality care  according to a new study that found first-rate treatment for cancer but insufficient primary care for other ailments.

column4: FCC chief seeks added review of AT&T/T-Mobile deal

column4: Chile state oil co ENAP secures $300 mln loan
column5: SANTIAGO  Nov 23 Chile's state oil company ENAP  which has been grappling with debt woes  said on Wednesday it had secured a $300 million 5-year loan with a group of banks to refinance debt.

column4: Analysis: World economy counts cost of euro zone dithering
column5: LONDON (Reuters)- From credit bottlenecks in eastern Europe to slower growth in China  delays in tackling the euro zone's debt crisis are causing ever-greater economic and financial damage well beyond the borders of the 17-nation bloc.

column5: Nov 23 A consortium led by private equity firm KKR & Co clinched a deal to buy oil and gas group Samson Investment Co for $7.2 billion  KKR said on Wednesday.

column4: Investor Icahn sells 2.9 million shares of Motorola
column5: Activist investor Carl Icahn reported in a regulatory filing that he sold 2.9 million shares of Motorola Mobility Holdings Inc for $114 million.

column5: German drugmaker Merck KGaA accused U.S. rival Merck & Co of hijacking its Facebook page and said it plans to sue to get it back.

column4: Merck to pay $950 million to settle U.S. Vioxx charge
column5: Merck & Co will pay roughly $950 million to settle criminal and civil charges that it promoted the painkiller Vioxx for an unapproved use  the U.S. Justice Department said on Tuesday.

column4: Moody's warns U.S. not to skimp on deficit cuts
column5: NEW YORK Moody's Investors Service on Wednesday warned that its top credit rating for the United States could be in jeopardy if lawmakers backtrack on $1.2 trillion in deficit cuts planned over 10 years.

column4: Groupon shares sink below $20 IPO price
column5: NEW YORK Shares of Groupon Inc fell for a third day on Wednesday  sinking below the company's initial public offering price of $20 less than three weeks after the daily deal company went public.

column4: Nomura in talks to sell real estate arm: report
column5: Nomura Holdings Inc  has started talks to sell domestic businesses including its real estate arm  the Financial Times reported  as Japan's top brokerage rushes to beef up cash in an ailing stock market.

column4: UPDATE 1-Nomura in talks to sell real estate arm - FT
column5: Nov 23 Nomura Holdings Inc has started talks to sell domestic businesses including its real estate arm  the Financial Times reported  as Japan's top brokerage rushes to beef up cash in an ailing stock market.

column4: Market Chatter -- Corporate finance press digest
column5: Nov 23The following corporate finance-related stories were reported by media on Wednesday:

column4: Nomura steps up its asset sale plans - FT
column5: Nov 22 Japan's Nomura Holdings has approached big private equity firms about the possible sale of domestic businesses including its real estate arm as the bank seeks to shore up its capital buffers  the Financial Times reported on Wednesday.

column4: DealTalk: Pfizer likely to spin off animal health: sources
column5: Pfizer Inc  is expected to spin off its animal health business rather than trigger a tax bill through a sale  while a decision on its infant nutritionals unit is dragging on  sources familiar with the situation said.

column4: DEALTALK-Pfizer likely to spin off animal health -sources
column5: * Animal health sale would face antitrust scrutiny -sources

column4: Canada competition watchdog clears Rio Tinto bid for Hathor
column5: MELBOURNE  Nov 23 Canada's competition watchdog has cleared global miner Rio Tinto's C$654 million ($630 million) takeover offer for Hathor Exploration   Rio Tinto said on Wednesday.

column4: Market situation is one of "utmost gravity" - RBS CEO
column5: LONDON  Nov 23 The current financial market turmoil must be viewed with the utmost seriousness  the chief executive of Royal Bank of Scotland said on Wednesday.

column4: HSBC  RBS reiterate concerns on UK regulatory costs
column5: LONDON  Nov 23 HSBC  and Royal Bank of Scotland both expressed concerns over the costs associated with proposed new rules for Britain's banks on Wednesday  such as making them hold "bail-in" bonds.

column4: S.Africa stocks hit month low on China data
column5: JOHANNESBURG  Nov 23 Johannesburg stocks fell to their lowest close in a month on Wednesday  as weak Chinese factory data sparked concerns about demand from the world's second-largest economy  hitting miner Assore  and luxury good maker Richemont.

column4: Thanksgiving box office glutted with family fare
column5: LOS ANGELES (TheWrap.com) - Family films are always a big part of the Thanksgiving box office equation  but this year multiplexes will be especially stuffed with the genre.

column4: UPDATE 2-United Utilities profit drops on higher spending
column5: * H1 underlying operating profit down about 1 pct to 324.2 mln stg

column4: UPDATE 1-Sumitomo Mitsui to partner Bank of China - Nikkei
column5: Nov 24 Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp (SMBC)  a subsidiary of Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group   is forming a partnership with Bank of China to help the Japanese lender's clients raise capital and make payments in yuan  business daily Nikkei said.

column4: Target in talks on credit card receivable deal
column5: Nov 23 Discount retailer Target Corp  said on Wednesday it was in negotiations for the sale of its credit card receivables and a deal could be reached by the end of the year.

column4: RPT-PREVIEW-U.S. chains brace for season of holiday discounts
column5: * Retail stocks have outperformed broad market this month

column4: Colombia may liquidate Telefonica joint venture
column5: BOGOTA  Nov 23 Colombia's government warned on Wednesday that it may liquidate a joint venture with Spanish telecoms giant Telefonica if local lawmakers do not approve a $3.9 billion capitalization plan.

column4: CORRECTED - Securian liable for $2.4 mln for alleged misrepresentation
column5: NEW YORK  Nov 23 A brokerage must pay an investor $2.4 million for failed investments in real estate limited partnerships that one of its brokers sold outside of the firm  a securities arbitration panel has ruled.

column4: Transocean to part ways with top manager Bobillier
column5: Nov 23 Transocean Ltd    owner of the world's largest offshore drilling fleet  announced the departure of a former high-flying executive as the company struggles to improve its performance.

column4: Life credits put a price tag on experience  help older workers
column5: Jeff Gentz  a pilot for United Parcel Service  wanted to get his college diploma if he was going to keep lecturing his teenage daughter about the importance of a university degree.

column4: UPDATE 2-UnitedHealth switches drug unit CEO amid expansion
column5: Nov 23 UnitedHealth Group Inc changed the leadership of its pharmacy benefit unit as the business readies for a major expansion that stands to pit it against Express Scripts Inc and CVS Caremark Corp .

column4: UnitedHealth switches drug unit CEO amid expansion
column5: UnitedHealth Group Inc has changed the leadership of its pharmacy benefit unit as the business readies for a major expansion that positions it as a competitor to the largest companies in the field.

column4: India cabinet to discuss FDI in multi-brand retail on Thurs
column5: NEW DELHI  Nov 23 India's federal cabinet on Thursday will discuss allowing 51 percent foreign direct investment (FDI) in multi-brand retail and 100 percent in single-brand retail  a government spokeswoman said on Wednesday.

column4: India may open multi-brand retail sector 'within weeks':finmin source
column5: NEW DELHI  Nov 23 The Indian cabinet will decide within weeks whether to allow retailers  such as Wal-Mart Stores Inc  to operate in the country with a majority stake  a source in the finance ministry said on Wednesday.

column4: U.S. judge sides with Netflix in antitrust lawsuit
column5: A U.S. judge granted Netflix's bid to resolve all claims in its favor before trial in an antitrust class action  in which plaintiffs had sought hundreds of millions of dollars in damages.

column5: * Wal-Mart previously agreed to settle for $27.25 million

column4: U.S. judge sides with Netflix in antitrust lawsuit
column5: Nov 22 A U.S. judge granted Netflix's  bid to resolve all claims in its favor before trial in an antitrust class action  where plaintiffs had alleged Netflix reached an agreement with Wal-Mart to divide the market for sales and online rentals of DVDs in the United States.
